ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Discussing some newly published papers in the field of geochemistry was educational. I learnt how to identify pitfalls in a scientific research work. I also improved my presentation skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I definitely would. The theme of the papers that we discuss changes every semester but it is always insightful to attend the discussions. While working on our PhDs it is hard to gather knowledge about other Geosciences fields. This seminar gives all grad students a chance to update themselves in areas outside of their research focus. Moreover, we get a chance to learn new concepts, and through our discussions, which involves faculty as well, we learn how to differentiate between a comprehensive research study and a poorly conducted one. I think this course is a must for all grad students.
